FuncDef:
The cpos-trunk command adds a CPOS interface to a CPOS-Trunk interface.
The undo cpos-trunk command deletes a CPOS interface from a CPOS-Trunk interface.
By default, CPOS-Trunk interfaces do not have any CPOS interfaces.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a CPOS-Trunk interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 127.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To increase bandwidth, improve reliability, and implement load balancing, run the cpos-trunk command to add a CPOS interface to a CPOS-Trunk interface.
Prerequisites
The CPOS-Trunk interface to which the CPOS interface is to be added has been created using the interface cpos-trunk command in the system view.
No other configurations exist on the CPOS interface except physical attribute-related configurations. Otherwise, the CPOS interface cannot be added to the CPOS-Trunk interface.
Before adding a CPOS interface to a CPOS-Trunk interface, run the aps group command on the CPOS interface to add it to an LMSP group.
Configuration Impact
After a CPOS interface is added to a CPOS-Trunk interface:
Bandwidth is increased: The bandwidth of the CPOS-Trunk interface totals the bandwidths of its member interfaces.Reliability is improved: When a member link fails, traffic automatically switches to other available member links.
If services have been configured on a CPOS-Trunk interface, they are carried over member interfaces.

Precautions
A CPOS interface can be added only to one CPOS-Trunk interface. Before adding it to another CPOS-Trunk interface, remove it from the current CPOS-Trunk interface.
If a CPOS interface and a CPOS-Trunk interface reside on different types of boards, the CPOS interface cannot be added to the CPOS-Trunk interface.
shutdown command on a CPOS-Trunk interface, the physical status of both the CPOS-Trunk interface and its member interfaces becomes Administratively DOWN, and the shutdown command configuration is automatically generated for the member interfaces in the configuration file.
undo shutdown command on a CPOS-Trunk interface, the undo shutdown command configuration is automatically generated for the member interfaces in the configuration file.
When the undo cpos-trunk command is run, check whether the CPOS interface in active status needs to be deleted from a CPOS-Trunk interface to prevent misoperation.
The configurations of IMA-Group/MP-group and CPOS-Trunk on the following CPOS subcards are mutually exclusive:
For the CR5D00C2CF70/CR5D00C4CF70 subcard:
a, When the CPOS interface numbered 0 is added to the CPOS-Trunk, IMA-group and MP-group interfaces are not supported on the subcard.
b, When IMA-group and MP-group interfaces are configured on the subcard, the CPOS interface numbered 0 cannot be added to the CPOS-Trunk.
For the CR5D00C8CF71 subcard:
a, When both CPOS interfaces numbered 0 and 4 are added to the CPOS-Trunk, MP-group and IMA-group interfaces cannot be configured on the subcard.
b, If only the CPOS interface numbered 0 is added to the CPOS-Trunk, IMA-group interfaces numbered from 257 to 512 and MP-group interfaces numbered from 129 to 256 cannot be configured on the subcard.
c, If only the CPOS interface numbered 4 is added to the CPOS-Trunk, IMA-group interfaces numbered from 1 to 256 and MP-group interfaces numbered from 1 to 128 cannot be configured on the subcard.
